title: Run Away Home
text:
Run Away Home is a 1997 book by <a href="Patricia%20McKissack">Patricia McKissack</a>. Set in the late 19th century, it is about an <a href="African-American">African-American</a> girl, Sarah Jane, who finds an <a href="Apache">Apache</a> boy in the family barn and the subsequent affects on their lives.
Reception.
"<a href="School%20Library%20Journal">School Library Journal</a>", in a review of "Run Away Home", wrote "Grabbing readers with wonderful characters, an engaging plot, and vital themes, McKissack weaves a compelling story of cultural clash, tragedy, accommodation, and ultimate triumph." while "<a href="Booklist">Booklist</a>" found it a "generally fast-paced story flags occasionally when information-heavy dialogue intrudes." and concluded "The happy ending ties things up too neatly, but this story is fine for the undemanding reader who wants an old-fashioned, feel-good saga."
"Run Away Home" has also been reviewed by "<a href="Publishers%20Weekly">Publishers Weekly</a>", and "<a href="The%20Horn%20Book%20Magazine">The Horn Book Magazine</a>".
